page.title: 08FARMING IN THE REGION
page.content: FARMING IS THE MOST IMPORTANT ASPECT OF THE ENTIRE REGION. ALMOST ALL OF THE LAND IS FARMED IN SOME WAY, WITH ALL THE ORIGINAL HOUSING DIRECTLY RELATED TO FARMING. FARMS VARY IN SIZE FROM 100 ACRES TO 1000 ACRES. SOME FARMERS ARE OWNERS WHILST OTHERS ARE TENANT WITH LAND BELONGING TO THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND AND OTHER LARGE AREAS TO CHRIST'S COLLEGE, CAMBRIDGE. THE FOLLOWING ARE THE IMPORTANT CROPS: WHEAT BARLEY, SUGAR BEET, LETTUCE, CABBAGE,RHUBARB,PEAS, BEANS, STRAWBERRIES, RASPBERRIES, LEEKS, BLACKCURRANTS AND GRASS FOR PASTURE. CATTLE, SHEEP AND PIGS ARE THE MAIN COMMERCIAL ANIMALS. THERE IS FORESTRY, FISH FARMING, BEES AND ROUGH SHOOTING. SOME CROPS ARE EVEN SOWN BY AEROPLANE. MANY ARE SENT TO MARKETS IN LONDON WITH OTHERS FOR FLOUR AND ANIMAL FEED.
